review_title: Great work culture, great plant manager, great co workers
pros: Great lead,great plant manager, great co workers.Team culture here.Anything you want to learn ask and they will show you. I like that the crews are small.Everyone knows everyone and helpful.You can transfer to other plants if there is openings in san diego. Management here is supportive of your endeavors to excel in the business.Open communication with plant manager and lead.Good benefits.
cons: Rainy days you don't get to work and can be off of work for a few days due to the plant being to muddy and the plant can't produce in those conditions. If you are the main breadwinner and only one working and a family to provide for this might not be the job for you.The hill going to the actual plant is not paved at this location, so sometimes you can get stuck if you don't have a pick up etc.Small crews for this plant so sometimes you will have to cover for those calling out.Pay is not that good here.Turn over rate is big here when dealing with temp to hire workers.Last minute notifications of shift schedule changes there are times I wanted to come in on last minute changes but could not sleep so opted out.Lost on money due to the last minute changes.Rainy day schedules will hurt your pocket as i mentioned before so consider that if only one working.Sometimes communication ball between managment and leaders are communicated timely to workers.

pros: Lower Level Management is capable and experienced. Coworkers are professional and proficient. Casual environment with variable volume of calls. Good pay with automatic pay raise after probation period.
cons: Middle Management is Horrendously Political and Micro-Managing. This is a company that cares about two things: Safety and Making Money. Do both and you'll last. Every mistake that costs money is documented and there's no forgiveness.

review_title: Horrible people who step on you to make it
pros: Some employees are amazing, others will stab you in the back

pros: Some really great people work for Martin and they just keep taking the abuse, either out of fear due to dictatorial managerial tactics or feeling like they could never do better elsewhere.  The company as a whole is doing well and I have seen some wonderful things but each district is run like a separate business with very little senior/executive management oversight.
cons: The upper management is dictatorial, negative re-enforcement is the law of the land.  Most employees work at a minimum of 80 to 100 hours per week.  Most mid-level mangers are made to do the work of three men. If there aren't enough employees to do the work the supervisors and superintendents, and managers are expected to pick up a shovel or turn  wrenches at 100 hours per week and being on salary it's borderline slavery.  I am an engineer and was told regularly to stop being so engineery, just fix it when it breaks.  Run to failure is their maintenance program.  Plants are budgeted by the accountants at the district offices, they never set foot in the plants.  No maintenance budgets, no maintenance forecasting.  This leads to your company cell phone always ringing with break downs and catastrophes at all hours of the night, Christmas, Thanksgiving, vacations, kiss em all good bye.  If you are looking for a salaried management position...RUN!!

job_title: Operations Manager in Colorado Springs, CO
pros:
Martin Marietta is far and away the best company I have ever worked for.  They have the best wage and benefits of all the other companies in the Heavy Highway Construction industry that I have worked for.  My bosses set the example of great managers and I couldn't be happier with following their lead.  From top to bottom Martin Marietta has a philosophy that anyone can be proud of (#1...Safety of all employees, then putting out a quality product, and then lastly...getting the job done within the customers schedule).  

I tell everyone that this is my career / profession, and I am very proud of what I have accomplished over the last 27 years of building highways all over Colorado.  And I look forward to the next 20 years at Martin Marietta of building not only projects, but also relationships with those I work with.
cons: In my position, I sometimes have to deal with the bureaucracy of getting a decision back from managers...which in some cases takes a little extra time...but thats really the only thing I can think of as a "Cons".  This is a fun place to work and everyone here knows that.

review_title: Excellent Benefits and Safety Culture, Average-Poor Management
pros: They claim safety is extremely important to them, good all around insurance package, pension plan, paid holidays and paid time off, bonus (salary only), sick time (salary only), choice of company car if you travel a lot, managers/coworkers are nice people for the most part, good HR managers, office location is in a decent area, depending on the job you will see a lot of the operations, CEO is growth minded and I expect the company to increase in size, can keep your job even if you aren't very good at what you do.
cons:
MUCH LOWER PAY than most companies, Advancement/Professional Growth is very limited, High rate of turnover, Little respect for manager's abilities, skills or experience, NEVER felt like I was working for a world-class organization, People are routinely assigned to tasks that they have no experience with.

Company Policy and Systems training is non existent; must learn on your own.

Safety is preached, but it is not practiced nearly as heavily as they claim. 

Dallas office is an "open concept" meaning you can see and hear EVERYONE - no offices, no cubicles, etc. 

NOT a family atmosphere

review_title: People are treated like pieces of equipment, you will not do what you were hired for.
pros: The people, you’re all in it together.
cons:
Low pay
Long hours
Unsafe environment
No one likes their job, they just tolerate it because it puts food on the table.

pros: Brand new truck for work and personal use. Plant managers are understanding and knowledgeable. They only get to their positions by internally promoting; no outside hires for production management. Many established departments to help operations.
cons: Unpredictable and varying hours; 60+ hours weekly salary. Pay is below market value because the company is well established. Upper management (area manager and above) will protect themselves and cut those below them to save themselves. The "safety card" of the culture is only played when it benefits someone. When executives aren't watching a lot of unsafe behavior occurs.

review_title: Hourly Employee reccomends working for Martin Marietta
job_title: Haul Truck Operator in Charlotte, NC
pros: Large company with strong financial support.  Knowledgeable and fair management with skilled workers.  Metropolitan area with good benefits.  Opportunities for advancement if showing proper work ethic and aptitude.  High levels of responsibility given to workers, team camaraderie strong.   The company leadership was impressive with a heavy focus on safety practices and ensuring a positive and safe work envinronment.  Plenty of opportunities for workers to discuss benefits and health insurance questions, 401-k and various HR issues, were made available.  Leadership from mine management and supervisors was prominent and education of various tasks was always performed in a professional manner by the more experienced mine workers.
cons: Hours for wage employees can be very long.  Overtime offsets long hours but can have multiple weeks in a row much longer hours than what would be expected.

pros: Martin's culture is a great combination of "old school" (strong benefits package, knowledgeable and friendly employees) and "new school" (moving more into automation, thinking of new ways to solve problems). For that reason, it's a great place to either begin a new career or to transfer in from another industry that might not be as stable as aggregates.  I've worked for several large companies in the Raleigh area, and Martin's culture is the best I've experienced.
cons: The only real negative against Martin is that they may be slightly below average in pay-scale. However, they have an excellent benefits package, including an actual pension plan on top of 401K matching, which is becoming very unique in the modern corporate culture.

review_title: Best ready mix company I have worked for - they appreciate the drivers!
pros: Good benefits, good pay and lots of overtime. Medical, Dental, short/long term disability.  They have a 401k and a pension. Safety is a BIG DEAL.  Managers support and expect safe work. Employees look out for each other on safety.  Mixer Trucks have Automatic Trans and gadgets to help the drivers - back up cameras, DriveCam, and automatic slump system. Good safety training and good safety equipment. Management listens to us. Good teamwork. Lots of locations and jobs are posted for promotions.
cons: Saturday work is common. Hours vary a lot depending on when the jobs pour.  Rain can shut down concrete pour jobs, but we have a 40 hour a$$ured pay that helps. No paid sick days if you are sick less than a week.

pros: Great co workers and managers. Great benefits, and pay is not too bad. Get to do a lot of different things and like any other job, you get out what you put into it. The company really takes care of us and they genuinely care. Believe me when I tell you, that is rare is most companies. Safety is there highest priority and they make sure you go home every night safe.
cons: Any job will have its cons, with this job, most would think that working out in the elements all day long, or long hours is a con, but for me, I enjoy being outside and I will take any overtime they give me.

review_title: The Best Company I've Ever Worked For!
pros: I'm approaching my two year mark at Martin Marietta and I still enjoy working for the company.   The company consistently stresses safety and ethics, both of which are very important to me.  The culture at Martin is different from anywhere else I have worked because they actually mean what they say.  Other companies I have seen say what sounds good, but rarely follow through.  Of course, the biggest plus for me is the people.  I'm not going to work someplace where I don't like the people.  I enjoy seeing the people I work with every day, and that's a blessing I do not take for granted.  I have been in jobs where this wasn't the case and I dreaded going to work each day.
cons: The work/life balance can get skewed at times due to production requirements.

review_title: It's a great place when you have friends in the right places
pros: Investing in your training, opportunities to travel and learn from other parts of the company, solid company financially, conservative in their strategy
cons: The ethics policy sounds great on paper until you actually need it. Once you make the call plan to pack it up. Internal politics is alive and well and if you are not liked they will find a way out for you.

pros: The management staff and training staff are wonderful. They really get you psyched ringer out there and work for them.
cons:
Unfortunately the department I was in was fragmented and decentralized. There is absolutely no order and entirely not enough experience. There are sever ways to skin a cat but you get a mess if you employ all of them at once. Very poor planning and way too much concern about how much u will owe for what little is issued to you and access to necessary parts that repairs take in
My opinion way longer than they should.

pros: I've been with the company almost ten years and have enjoyed every day. All of the people that I interact with are very professional. Within our division it has the feel of a large family. Make no mistake you are expected to execute your job to the best of your ability however its all the other pieces that contribute to make this organization great. Honesty, transparency, leadership, ethics are a few of the strong points from the CEO through the ranks of employee's. When you talk to other co workers its a discussion about the team and how to improve the team vs I or me..... The company is on a journey and I'm proud to be part of the team.
cons: Work/life balance gets stretched at times.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Martin Marietta is far and away the best company in the aggregate, ready mix and asphalt/paving industry.  With a sharp focus on safety, ethics and sustainability, Martin Marietta strives to provide long and prosperous careers for its employees.  I am part of a newer acquisition and can say without a doubt that this company has implemented a culture that our employees are very excited about.  I have worked for several publicly held building materials companies and consider Martin Marietta the standard.
cons: I do not have any cons.  I enjoy what I am doing and the company provides the support we need to be successful.

review_title: Not what they tell you it is
job_title: Heavy Equipment Operator in Bridgeport, TX
pros: Good insurance and retirement benefits. They have alot of safety rules and give everyone the right to stop any job if you feel that it is not being done safely.
cons: Pay rate is much lower than average and there is very little opportunity for advancement. The work schedule changes on a daily basis and many times they will wait until the last minute to tell you if you're working or not. There is no appreciation for doing more than is asked of you. They only let you know when you didnt do as good as they would have liked.

pros: Great company with great benefits that includes a pension plan. Days fly by because there is so much work to do and you will never be bored. There is a lot of room for advancement - either at the Lakewood office, any of the other offices in different states, or at corporate in Raleigh.
cons: You are spread thin and you have to fight for a raise.

review_title: Good job but MM management not so great
pros: People at facility I worked at were great, helpful. Good pay and plant operations manager let you know you were doing well and was appreciated. Greatly enjoyed working with my co-workers and job responsibilities.
cons: Martin Marietta owned facility for only 1 year before deciding they couldn't properly manage efficiently in California and they were located in North Carolina. Should have been thought out thoroughly before making the purchase. You put a lot of good people out on the street. And at the meeting when they told us the plant was sold and would be shut down, the big shots from North Carolina acted like no big deal. They still had their jobs.

review_title: Dan is great but he is neither the CEO or COO.
pros: The company is stable compared to the competition.  There is enough foresight to anticipate large economic swings and prepare.  Everyone is responsible, and held responsible, at Martin Marietta Materials.  I do not know a single employee that does not contribute to the overall success of the company.
cons: unrealistice expectations of what can be acomplished in a work day.  Demanding too much at the last minute with little detail about what is needed or expected.  Demanding more than is able to be acomplished with great results instead of good results.

review_title: It pays the bills, but stay out of the operations side if you can.
pros: Pay is OK, maybe slightly below industry standards. Most people are nice to work with.
cons:
Area management expects those who supervise and manage the quarries to do so with almost no manpower or resources. Very common for a manager to be doing 2 or more people's duties for months at a time because running lean is the "new normal". 12+ hour days are the standard, plus mandatory weekend work. Not a good fit if you have anything in your life that interests you besides work, because the work/life balance is a joke.

If you have an engineering or other degree I would recommend district/division/corporate positions only, because you will get worked to death in the operations.

pros: They pay well but, at the time you had to put in the hours for it.  At one point I was working 80 to 90 hours a week but now they are working 6 81/2 hour days.  I loved the people that I worked with on a normal basis.
cons: Management will lie right to your face.  There is a horrible relationship between management and the Union.  When I had left management had just went against the contract and changed our hours.  They have since lost in court and had to change to hours to something different.

pros: Martin Marietta is a great place to work and I am very proud to say I work there.  It is a fortune 500 company that feels like a much smaller family company.  The culture of the company fosters mutual respect up and down the organization and allows for personal growth.  It invests heavily in its people in order to see them grow personally and in their careers.  It is easy for companies to say that people are their most valuable asset but at Martin Marietta I feel this is true.
cons: Overall, Martin Marietta, is a great place to work.  Martin Marietta wants its employees to have a career with Martin Marietta not just a job.

review_title: Great company to work with but emphasis seems more about the business profits vs employees and work life balance.
pros: Great Fortune 500 company to work for that has a solid reputation in the workforce and solid business presence.  Great benefits are offered to their employees and depending on the team / district that you work for, can be a wonderful place to build a long lasting career. Many employees stay with the company for multiple decades which is impressive.
cons: Career path for accounting and finance seems to end without CPA license

review_title: Martin Marietta doesn't walk the talk
pros: Good benefits, but that is also pretty standard across the industry
cons: Pay is lower than industry competition. Management treats hourly employees like they are brainless and all positions management are a big political game. Managers regularly lie to employees and pressure supervisors to do the same thing. You are expected to work a lot of hours and are chastised for taking vacation/sick days. Management preaches ethics up until the point that it is inconvenient for them. As long as your boss likes you there will be room to grow in the company. Overall, the CEO had good ideas, but middle management had poor execution.

pros: I've been involved in several projects since starting at Martin Marietta of varying levels of complexity.  I've found the thing I enjoy most about working here is how easy it is to work cross functionally with other teams in the company.  I'm always able to find people throughout the company willing to pitch in to help, which has greatly benefited the work I'm about to produce.
cons: The company doesn't currently offer paid paternity leave, and doesn't have the ability to work from home on a regular basis.

pros: The best company that I've worked for in decades. Safety, Customer Service and Quality and the most important priorities. The management team truly cares about the employees and it starts from the top down. It's great to be in an environment that coworkers get along and have some fun while getting the job done serving customers.
cons: I don't have a lot of cons for the company. The Denver market has it's challenges of traffic, high housing  costs, and some social nuances that need to be recognized for new comers to the area.

review_title: Work all the time and avoid getting stabbed in the back.
pros: They pay you but not very well.  They do have some newer plants but that means fewer people to keep cost down.
cons: You get to work all of the time.  You start at 5 am and get to go home around 7 pm.  Don't forget you get to work the weekends also.  Don't come in on Sunday you get yelled at.  Sales, QC, HR, and Management all spend time pointing fingers and trying to stab one another in the back. They do not fix the actual problems.  So if you like long crushing hours and getting blamed when your employees do something dumb its a great company to work for.

pros: Excellent pay and benifits. Good ole boy sytem is in place in certain departments. The people are really nice. Upper management try to work with you as much as they can but have responsibilities to Senior management.
cons: Senior management only cares about the bottom line. You can be the best employeee and belong to the family but if sales are down and they cant get their bonus you will be cut.

pros: I've been at Martin for 17 years.    This is truly one of the good-guy companies.  A strong belief in ethics, safety and respect for employees is what we're about.  This outfit is on the rise and it's been a pleasure to be on the ride.  If you work hard and do your job you'll have a career at Martin for as long as you want.  I wouldn't trade my experience for anything.
cons: The construction business is cyclical and downturns can happen.  This can make working in the industry tough.

review_title: Long Term if you like getting paid under market
pros: pension, good experience, industry leader, free swag
cons: terrible pay unless you are part of operations, little to no growth opportunity, upper management is not transparent at all, you only get a raise above cost of living if you beg for one and then they guilt trip you.

review_title: Poor management all the way around
pros: Decent pay.  Good benefits
cons: Abysmal management.  One manager was simply incompetent while others around enabled this to continue far too long.  Constant drain on your psyche with high stress levels and no replenishment.  Old school approach to technology despite the rows of magazines stating MMM is a top 500 leader in tech (what a joke).

pros: Martin Marietta is a safety-focused, ethical, and high performing company that has been in business for many decades. The Company cares deeply about its employees and customers, which has resulted in industry-leading growth over the past several years. It is the most employee benefit friendly company I have ever worked for and is one of the few remaining companies to offer a defined benefit pension plan as part of an already comprehensive benefits package. If you are a safe, ethical, and hard-working person, you will find a long-term career at Martin.
cons: There are no major downsides to working at Martin Marietta.

job_title: Plant Operator/Equiptment Operator in Alden, IA
pros: Plenty of overtime pays the bills, good insurance
cons:
$17/ yr  yr of service toward your pension as  an hrly employee.
   It's who you are,  Saftey rules are made up
 punishments aren't the same for everyone. 
 back stabbing management, favoritism, 
no human resource dept/ relations=no rights as an employee

review_title: Great place to build a career
pros: Martin Marietta's Culture is built on a solid foundation of ethical behavior, safety always and continuous improvement through thoughtful attention to detail.  Martin Marietta is committed to excellence, its people and its shareholders.  The company is interested in building careers not just jobs.
cons: The company expects a lot from its employees. Compared to peers, overhead cost is extremely low. But, it is a rewarding and challenging place to work and build a career.

pros: The Insurance is ok and that's really the only Pro. They did have a lot of good drivers that took care of each other only bc management didn't help with anything.
cons: Management treats drivers like crap.The entire company really only looks out for their Managers. Horrible Hours. If you have a family stay away because they think you are supposed to Revolve your life around Martin Marietta. Their equipment and plants are all junk that they do not maintain. Never checked their Job sites to see if they were safe instead they always relied on the driver to do it. Their entire Safety Dept is a complete joke and waste of time.

job_title: Haul Truck Operator in Charlotte, NC
pros: This company offer good pay and decent benefits.
cons: You will be at work....all the time....They have a total disregard to one's home life and couldn't care less about family issues or your life outside of work. Management plays favorites. They push a safety culture, but rarely will you see anyone being safe. PPE is scarce when needed.

job_title: Loader Operator in Port Arthur, TX
pros: company has great benefits, safety practices off the chart. locations all over the U.S. large aggregate company moving into concrete many opportunities
cons: long hours,  mostly six days a week, pay is considered low for my area, equipment kind of slow to be repaired

review_title: management retaliation when an employee asserts their right to challenge a perceived wrong
job_title: Batch Plant Operator in Lewisville, TX
pros: fair pay with steady work, especially if your one of their favorites
cons: The Mc Clure mafia. Their is a large group of family members all in the Dallas area and some do not do their job. But are protected by one of the family's higher positions in the company.

pros: Depending on where you're at you either have a lot of opportunity to control your atmosphere and equipment or not. I was, from how I understand it, very fortunate to be in the Augusta GA area.
cons: Low pay for an electricians skill set. Decent benefits though. Very little room for growth. Once you're an electrician there are very few jobs for which to compete for above your level.

job_title: Industrial Maintenance Technician in Dallas, TX
pros: Guaranteed hours good benefits pension and 401k
cons: A lot of zero tolerance rules. One strike and you are out could cost you a very valuable employee A lot of unqualified employees in position they don't know hoe to handle. A lot of good ole boy clubs

pros: The people employed at Martin Marietta are among the best in the industry!  Safety is truly the most important thing from Ward Nye down to every employee.  The benefits are out of this world: pension, 401(k) contributions, tuition reimbursement, scholarship opportunities for your children, good pay, excellent health/dental/vision.  Growth opportunities abound.
cons: There aren't cons.  I left for a bit and came running back!

review_title: VERY VERY old school and not in a good way
pros: Benefits are pretty good and on-site gym staffed with trainers
cons: Everything from processes and procedures to technology are behind the times. I feel like this place is stuck in the late 90's. There is no opportunity for advancement, no management support, lack of development opportunities, communication within department and outside of the department is non-existent. ZERO flexibility regardless of what they say.

job_title: Vice President and General Manager in Dallas, TX
pros:
Safety is the priority, Safety Culture,
Commitment to Employees, Endless focus on continuous improvement,
Resilience to overcome adversity, Customer focused, Relentless in delivering value
cons: If you're someone that seeks complacency, it's certainly not the place for you. Those who are here and striving to be the best appreciate this!

pros: One of the best things about Martin Marietta Materials is the people.  Its a solid, ethical company.
cons: Based on business need, sometimes there is not as much flexibility as would be preferred.  However, management is usually quite tolerant of work/life balance issues.

review_title: A Possible Fit Depending On You Needs
pros: Safety is a major consideration while working. All proper procedures are followed to allow for a safe work environment. Benefits start from the first day of employment.
cons: There is a disconnect between management and the workers. Scheduling has been inconsistent and your first month is frustrating because you get bounced around between positions. Many things are fixed to get by instead of fixed properly.

review_title: Overall a good place to work but company culture has changed in last few years.
pros:
Overall compensation and benefits package are competitive for most positions.
Good team work inside of departments in most cases but issues across departments at times
cons:
Lots of churn right now in some departments about future direction. 
Different divisions are sometimes at odds with overall corporate ideas

pros: I had the privilege to work with and for some very nice people at MLM. They were genuine people who cared about the employee as a person.
cons: Each division of the company was like working at a completely different company - management style, culture, etc.  The divisions were highly territorial.

review_title: Large Corporation with a Small Business Feeling
pros: Growing company with the wind at their back! Very strategic business decisions have put Martin Marietta in a very good position within the industry- I'm glad to be a part of it! Ethics and safety are held to the highest standard. This is a company that practices what it preaches. Compensation and benefits are top notch. I'm excited to see what the future holds for MM.
cons: I have not experienced any cons.

review_title: Company is great. Management not so great.
pros: Decent salary. 401k. Vacations. Most co-workers were like family. We used to do great Christmas parties and birthday celebrations.
cons: Senior management consisted of a group of unethical guys. I heard they were eventually let go. I would not have left the company if corporate had admitted the problems sooner.

pros: Martin Marietta is a World Class Company.  I have served the company for almost a decade and have been treated with respect and fairness in all aspects.  Martin Marietta is a company for a career, not just a job.  It has unlimited growth and opportunities for all employees.  I am very thankful to work for such a great company that cares for its employees so much.
cons: The company could utilize more technology in their processes.

pros: Decent pay $17 hr.  Good intentions but falling short of corporation expectations.
cons: During my employment the truck are trash. There's effort to make them look good although they'll still run like crap. Bad directions to job sites. Crappie job assignment if you're not favoured by dispatching. Being held accountable for issues out of your control.

review_title: Upper management has no clue and is out of touch.  They need to listen to their employees more.
job_title: Fleet Maintenance Manager in Dallas, TX
pros: Pay is decent and benefits are pretty good.  Some of the staff are pretty knowledgeable and have a clue on what to do.
cons: Good ‘Ol’ Boy network.  If your not a “yes” man and have something to say don’t expect to stay long.

review_title: Great benefits and a good company in general
pros: Great benefits including a pension plan. They are very supportive and friendly. Good working environment. Their safety program is one of the best.
cons: A few managers are unethical and seems like they are untouchable. There is not a structured succession planning nor a supportive way to advance in your career

pros: Company has grown considerably in the past 5 years and many changes are in motion from a systems and processes perspective.  All changes are for the better and the trajectory of the company is very positive.  Focus is placed on relationships and how employees work together.  Employee benefits are solid.
cons: Workload can be heavy at times but not so much of a "Con" as it is a reality of a healthy construction climate and growing company.

review_title: Good working environment, but you have to make friends with the "right" people
pros: Coworkers are awesome, good benefits, good working environment
cons: Management plays favorites, if you are not one of the "pets" you will not advance and I have seen many a good employee get forced out if they were not liked personally ( had nothing to do with their job performance).

review_title: Stable company - Very Low Salaries - No Growth Opportunities
pros: The company overall seems to be a stable business.

review_title: This company is circling the drain
job_title: Plant Operator in Du Bois, NE
pros:
The pay was decent for an equipment operator
Plenty of available overtime
If you can get hired as a manager, human resources, or any office job, you'll have it made.  They all typically leave early and yet have higher salaries.  When tools get replaced, they get to take the old ones home!
cons:
The company is focused on the appearance of safety, but if you aren't a manager your concerns were never addressed.  If an accident happened as a result, a root cause analysis was done and the operator or one of the other grunts is held responsible.  Human Resources is a joke, NOBODY is looking out for the laborers or operators interests, they solely represent the managers, because of the hierarchy system within the company.  I had to work 58hr/week almost every week and I considered myself grateful, some guys from Weeping Water mine claimed 70+ was common.

The whole time I'd worked there I had NEVER seen a manager held accountable for ANYTHING.  The company consistently promotes the WORST possible people for any management position.  Promotions are done on a buddy system, jobs are never posted internally, and the guy that sucks up to the boss the most is the one who receives the promotion.

I quit a year after never receiving a raise for what I thought was a promotion, I was promised a raise when taking the plant operator/maintenance position.  I never received the raise, the pay scale increase went to a new hire that happened to be the manager's friend.

I've created good friendships while working for Martin Marietta, I'd recently talked with some of my friends who say the job has gotten even worse since I've left.  Three have and one currently is retiring early as a result, the rest are currently searching for different jobs.
